item.title: Disscussion On Nulls
item.dc:creator: @pmgz2 pmgz2
item.description:
@pmgz2 wrote:

I know you might have problems with nulls on your server, as so am i, but only a few thankfully. so i found a way to get rid of them! or so i think… if you ever looked at your players online list, it says:

The Name:

“Null”

and the coordinates of:
-1, -1.

well the coords you might not see, but for me you do because its a custom menu…Anyways!

i made this! Which would indefinitely stop the nulls from being “registered as online” but it won’t stop them from logging in…

if(absX == -1 || absY == -1) { disconnected = true; }

That should stop the nulls! but as you might know or not, that when you log onto the server your registered as the coordinates -1, -1. you know, when you have that black screen? yeah you have those coordinates…Anyways the peice of code i put above would disconnect you!! so we have to put it in a place where it is delayed about 5 or 7 seconds, which I dont know! i tried to use my no lag timer, but its only 1.5 secs. which isn’t enough i tried changing up the numbers but not luck, dunno why.

Now another part:

to differentiate the Nulls From the Actual Players:

if(absX == -1 || absY == -1) { heightLevel = 0; teleportToX = xcoord; teleportToY = ycoord; }

it would get rid of that black screen that you might get when logging onto a server. and of course it won’t teleport nulls there -.-. i’ve tried doesn’t work lol…but i did get a rather unusual null, by the name of “JJ”, i checked the ip it was Local Host…and the password was the same as my password, so i really think nulls come from peoples computer, i mean the actual server owners! even saw the coords: -1, -1.

So please post suggestions on how to put in a place where its called, void perphaps? but i doubt it, anyways i’m open to suggestions!

Read full topic
